byline.contributor: Kevin Sack reported from Tallahassee, and Steve Eder from New York. Kitty Bennett and Agustin Armendariz contributed research.
byline.original: By KEVIN SACK and STEVE EDER

abstract: Documents secured by New York Times reveal that $25,000 campaign contribution from Donald J Trump to political action committee supporting Florida Atty Gen Pam Bondi was made four days before Orlando Sentinel published article about Bondi's office looking into allegations of fraud against Trump University; finding undercuts in part previous narrative of events; while Trump has denied trying to influence Bondi, he has boasted repeatedly of his political donations.
lead_paragraph: Documents obtained this week by The New York Times, including a copy of Mr. Trump’s check, at least partly undercut a timeline that looked like a quid pro quo.
snippet: Documents obtained this week by The New York Times, including a copy of Mr. Trump’s check, at least partly undercut a timeline that looked like a quid pro quo....

headline.main: New Records Shed Light on Donald Trump’s $25,000 Gift to Florida Official
headline.print_headline: New Light on Trump’s $25,000 Support of an Attorney General
